prompt:
Patient: 74 F
Referral: Dr. Chen
Pre-op Dx: C34.90
Procedure: Flexible Bronchoscopy, Aspiration, APC
Target: Trachea
APC Settings: Pulse 1, 1.5mm Side-fire probe
Plan: Repeat in 4-6 weeks
completion:
NOTE_ID: note_061
SOURCE_FILE: note_061.txt

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: March 06, 2025 CC Referred Physician: Dr. Chen

INDICATION FOR OPERATION She is a 74-year-old female who presents for bronchoscopy for stent evaluation.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient indicated a wish to proceed with surgery and informed consent was signed.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

C34.90 Malignant neoplasm of unspecified part of unspecified bronchus or lung

Airway obstruction 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

C34.90 Malignant neoplasm of unspecified part of unspecified bronchus or lung

Trachea obstruction requiring ablation 

PROCEDURE

Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscopy 

Therapeutic aspiration of tracheobronchial tree (initial episode) (CPT 31645) 

Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) (CPT 31641) 

Airway stent evaluation 

ATTENDING Dr. Bowers

ASSISTANT Dr. Fox

SUPPORT STAFF RN: Mike Ross RT: Anne Hathaway

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC (Argon Plasma Coagulation) system.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.
Patient Position: Supine.

Initial Airway Inspection and Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus and mucus plug.

Trachea Intervention (APC Ablation) Endobronchial obstruction at the Trachea was identified.
The obstruction was treated with the following modalities:


Modality: APC (Argon Plasma Coagulation) 


Tool: 1.5mm Side-fire probe


Setting/Mode: Pulse 1


Duration: 15 seconds

Tissue was successfully ablated.
Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

None 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

74-year-old F presented for stent evaluation.

Significant mucus plugging in Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem was cleared via therapeutic aspiration.
Trachea obstruction was successfully ablated using APC.


Plan: Repeat bronchoscopy in 4-6 weeks.

prompt: 74yo female stent eval. C34.90. suctioned airways. Used APC on Right Mainstem obstruction (15 seconds). attending Dr. Ingraham. no comps. f/u 2-3 months.

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: December 26, 2025 CC Referred Physician: Dr. Johnson

INDICATION FOR OPERATION He is a 74-year-old male who presents for bronchoscopy for stent evaluation.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient indicated a wish to proceed with surgery and informed consent was signed.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J39.8 Other specified diseases of upper respiratory tract

Airway obstruction 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J39.8 Other specified diseases of upper respiratory tract

Left Mainstem obstruction requiring ablation 

PROCEDURE

Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscopy 

Therapeutic aspiration of tracheobronchial tree (initial episode) (CPT 31645) 

Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) (CPT 31641) 

Airway stent evaluation 

ATTENDING Dr. Ingraham

ASSISTANT Dr. Jacobs

SUPPORT STAFF RN: Emily Blunt RT: Jessica Chastain

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC (Argon Plasma Coagulation) system.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.
Patient Position: Supine.

Initial Airway Inspection and Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus and mucus plug.

Left Mainstem Intervention (APC Ablation) Endobronchial obstruction at the Left Mainstem was identified.
The obstruction was treated with the following modalities:


Modality: APC (Argon Plasma Coagulation) 


Tool: 2.3mm Straight probe


Setting/Mode: Forced 30W


Duration: 5 seconds

Tissue was successfully ablated.
Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

None 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

Significant mucus plugging in Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem was cleared via therapeutic aspiration.
Left Mainstem obstruction was successfully ablated using APC.


Plan: Repeat bronchoscopy in 2-3 months.

Bronchus Intermedius obstruction requiring ablation 

PROCEDURE

Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscopy 

Therapeutic aspiration of tracheobronchial tree (initial episode) (CPT 31645) 

Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) (CPT 31641) 

Airway stent evaluation 

ATTENDING Dr. Ingraham

ASSISTANT Dr. Gupta

SUPPORT STAFF RN: Sarah Jones RT: Tom Cruise

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC (Argon Plasma Coagulation) system.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL

After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.
Patient Position: Supine.

Initial Airway Inspection and Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus and mucus plug.

Bronchus Intermedius Intervention (APC Ablation) Endobronchial obstruction at the Bronchus Intermedius was identified.
The obstruction was treated with the following modalities:


Modality: APC (Argon Plasma Coagulation) 


Tool: 2.3mm Straight probe


Setting/Mode: Forced 30W


Duration: 5 seconds

Tissue was successfully ablated.
Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

None
